00052 General::BitSteering General::str2BitSteering(const QString& str) {

00056         else if (str == QString("off")) {
00057                 return General::OFF;

00059         else {
00060                 return General::BITSTEERING_UNSPECIFIED;

00078 General::PortMap::PortMap(): logicalPort_(),
00079                 logicalVector_(), physicalPort_(), physicalVector_() {
00080 }
00081 
00082 General::PortMap::PortMap(QDomNode &portMap): logicalPort_(),
00083                 logicalVector_(), physicalPort_(), physicalVector_() {
00084 
00085         for (int i = 0; i < portMap.childNodes().count(); ++i) {
00086 
00087                 QDomNode tempNode = portMap.childNodes().at(i);
00088 
00089                 if (tempNode.nodeName() == QString("spirit:logicalPort")) {
00090 
00091                         // search childNodes for name and vector elements
00092                         for (int j = 0; j < tempNode.childNodes().count(); ++j) {
00093 
00094                                 if (tempNode.childNodes().at(j).nodeName() ==
00095                                                 QString("spirit:name")) {
00096 
00097                                         // get the logical name and strip whitespace characters
00098                                         logicalPort_= tempNode.childNodes().at(j).childNodes().
00099                                                         at(0).nodeValue();
00100                                         logicalPort_ = General::removeWhiteSpace(logicalPort_);
00101                                 }
00102 
00103                                 else if (tempNode.childNodes().at(j).nodeName() ==
00104                                                 QString("spirit:vector")) {
00105                                         QDomNode vectorNode = tempNode.childNodes().at(j);
00106 
00107                                         logicalVector_ = QSharedPointer<Vector>(
00108                                                         new Vector(vectorNode));
00109                                 }
00110                         }
00111 
00112                 }
00113                 else if (tempNode.nodeName() == QString("spirit:physicalPort")) {
00114 
00115                         // search for a spirit:vector element
00116                         for (int j = 0; j < tempNode.childNodes().count(); ++j) {
00117 
00118                                 if (tempNode.childNodes().at(j).nodeName() ==
00119                                                 QString("spirit:name")) {
00120 
00121                                         // get the physical name and strip the whitespace characters
00122                                         physicalPort_ = tempNode.childNodes().at(j).childNodes().
00123                                                         at(0).nodeValue();
00124                                         physicalPort_ = General::removeWhiteSpace(physicalPort_);
00125                                 }
00126 
00127                                 else if (tempNode.childNodes().at(j).nodeName() ==
00128                                                 QString("spirit:vector")) {
00129                                         QDomNode vectorNode = tempNode.childNodes().at(j);
00130 
00131                                         physicalVector_ = QSharedPointer<Vector>(
00132                                                         new Vector(vectorNode));
00133                                 }
00134                         }
00135                 }
00136         }
00137 
00138         if (logicalPort_.isNull()) {
00139                 throw Parse_error(QObject::tr("Mandatory name for spirit:logicalPort"
00140                                 " missing"));
00141                 return;
00142         }
00143 
00144         if (physicalPort_.isNull()) {
00145                 throw Parse_error(QObject::tr("Mandatory name for spirit:pysicalPort"
00146                                 " missing"));
00147                 return;
00148         }
00149         return;
00150 }

00152 General::PortMap::PortMap( const PortMap& other ): 
00153 logicalPort_(other.logicalPort_),
00154 logicalVector_(),
00155 physicalPort_(other.physicalPort_),
00156 physicalVector_() {
00157 
00158         if (other.logicalVector_)
00159                 logicalVector_ = QSharedPointer<Vector>(new Vector(*other.logicalVector_));
00160 
00161         if (other.physicalVector_)
00162                 physicalVector_ = QSharedPointer<Vector>(new Vector(*other.physicalVector_));
00163 }
00164 
00165 General::PortMap& General::PortMap::operator=( const PortMap& other ) {
00166         if (this != &other) {
00167                 logicalPort_ = other.logicalPort_;
00168                 if (other.logicalVector_)
00169                         logicalVector_ = QSharedPointer<Vector>(new Vector(*other.logicalVector_.data()));
00170                 else
00171                         logicalVector_ = QSharedPointer<Vector>();
00172 
00173                 physicalPort_ = other.physicalPort_;
00174                 if (other.physicalVector_)
00175                         physicalVector_ = QSharedPointer<Vector>(new Vector(*other.physicalVector_.data()));
00176                 else
00177                         physicalVector_ = QSharedPointer<Vector>();
00178         }
00179         return *this;
00180 }

00201                 port1Right_ = other.port1Right_;

00208 
00209 General::PortAlignment General::calculatePortAlignment( 
00210         const PortMap* portMap1, 
00211         int phys1LeftBound, 
00212         int phys1RightBound, 
00213         const PortMap* portMap2,
00214         int phys2LeftBound, 
00215         int phys2RightBound ) {
00216 
00217         General::PortAlignment alignment;
00218         
00219         // if the port maps are for different logical ports
00220         if (portMap1->logicalPort_ != portMap2->logicalPort_) {
00221                 return alignment;
00222         }
00223 
00224         // if port 1 is vectored on the port map
00225         if (portMap1->physicalVector_) {
00226                 phys1LeftBound = portMap1->physicalVector_->getLeft();
00227                 phys1RightBound = portMap1->physicalVector_->getRight();
00228         }
00229 
00230         // if port 2 is vectored on the port map
00231         if (portMap2->physicalVector_) {
00232                 phys2LeftBound = portMap2->physicalVector_->getLeft();
00233                 phys2RightBound = portMap2->physicalVector_->getRight();
00234         }
00235 
00236         // if both have vectored logical signals
00237         if (portMap1->logicalVector_ && portMap2->logicalVector_) {
00238 
00239                 // if the vectored ports don't have any common bounds
00240                 if (portMap1->logicalVector_->getRight() > portMap2->logicalVector_->getLeft() ||
00241                         portMap1->logicalVector_->getLeft() < portMap2->logicalVector_->getRight()) {
00242                                 return alignment;
00243                 }
00244 
00245                 int logicalLeft = qMin(portMap1->logicalVector_->getLeft(), 
00246                         portMap2->logicalVector_->getLeft());
00247                 int logicalRight = qMax(portMap1->logicalVector_->getRight(),
00248                         portMap2->logicalVector_->getRight());
00249 
00250                 {
00251                         // count how much the left bound of port 1 has to be adjusted down
00252                         int downSize = abs(portMap1->logicalVector_->getLeft() - logicalLeft);
00253                         // count how must the right bound of  port 1 has to be adjusted up
00254                         int upSize = abs(logicalRight - portMap1->logicalVector_->getRight());
00255 
00256                         alignment.port1Left_ = phys1LeftBound - downSize;
00257                         alignment.port1Right_ = phys1RightBound + upSize;
00258                 }
00259                 {
00260                         // count how much the left bound of port 2 has to be adjusted down
00261                         int downSize = abs(portMap2->logicalVector_->getLeft() - logicalLeft);
00262                         // count how must the right bound of  port 2 has to be adjusted up
00263                         int upSize = abs(logicalRight - portMap2->logicalVector_->getRight());
00264 
00265                         alignment.port2Left_ = phys2LeftBound - downSize;
00266                         alignment.port2Right_ = phys2RightBound + upSize;
00267                 }
00268         }
00269         // if port map1 has vectored logical signal
00270         else if (portMap1->logicalVector_ && !portMap2->logicalVector_) {
00271 
00272                 // port 1 uses the original physical bounds
00273                 alignment.port1Left_ = phys1LeftBound;
00274                 alignment.port1Right_ = phys1RightBound;
00275 
00276                 // port 2 uses the bounds of the logical port of port 1
00277                 alignment.port2Left_ = portMap1->logicalVector_->getLeft();
00278                 alignment.port2Right_ = portMap1->logicalVector_->getRight();
00279         }
00280         // if port map2 has vectored logical signal
00281         else if (!portMap1->logicalVector_ && portMap2->logicalVector_) {
00282 
00283                 // port 1 uses the bounds of the logical port of port 2
00284                 alignment.port1Left_ = portMap2->logicalVector_->getLeft();
00285                 alignment.port1Right_ = portMap2->logicalVector_->getRight();
00286 
00287                 // port 2 uses the original physical bounds
00288                 alignment.port2Left_ = phys2LeftBound;
00289                 alignment.port2Right_ = phys2RightBound;
00290         }
00291         // if neither has vectored logical signal
00292         else {
00293 
00294                 // both ports use the original physical bounds
00295                 alignment.port1Left_ = phys1LeftBound;
00296                 alignment.port1Right_ = phys1RightBound;
00297                 alignment.port2Left_ = phys2LeftBound;
00298                 alignment.port2Right_ = phys2RightBound;
00299         }
00300 
00301         // check if the sizes of the ports match
00302         int port1Size = phys1LeftBound - phys1RightBound + 1;
00303         int port2Size = phys2LeftBound - phys2RightBound + 1;
00304         if (port1Size != port2Size) {
00305                 alignment.invalidAlignment_ = true;
00306         }
00307         else {
00308                 alignment.invalidAlignment_ = false;
00309         }
00310         return alignment;
00311 }

00313 QString General::toPhysString( const PortMap& portMap ) {
00314         QString str = portMap.physicalPort_;
00315         // if the physical port is vectored.
00316         if (portMap.physicalVector_) {
00317                 str += portMap.physicalVector_->toString();
00318         }
00319         return str;
00320 }

00325         if (portMap.logicalVector_) {

00331 QString General::port2String(const QString& portName, int leftBound, int rightBound) {
00332         QString str(portName);
00333         str += QString("[%1..%2]").arg(leftBound).arg(rightBound);
00334         return str;

00374 General::Initiative General::str2Initiative(QString str,
00375                 General::Initiative defaultValue) {
00376 
00377         // select the correct enum value that matches the string
00378         if (str == QString("requires")) {
00379                 return General::REQUIRES;
00380         }
00381         else if (str == QString("provides")) {
00382                 return General::PROVIDES;
00383         }
00384         else if (str == QString("both")) {
00385                 return General::BOTH;
00386         }
00387         else if (str == QString("phantom")) {
00388                 return General::INITIATIVE_PHANTOM;
00389         }
00390         else {
00391                 return defaultValue;
00392         }
00393 }

00454                 General::Direction defaultValue) {
00455 
00456         // convert QString into Direction

00459         }
00460         else if (str == QString("out")) {

00462         }

00465         }
00466         else if (str == QString("phantom")) {

00468         }
00469         else {

00471         }

00495 General::Direction General::convert2Mirrored(const Direction originalDirection ) {
00496         switch (originalDirection) {
00497                 case General::IN: 
00498                         return General::OUT;
00499                 case General::OUT:
00500                         return General::IN;
00501                 case General::INOUT:
00502                         return General::INOUT;
00503                 case General::DIRECTION_PHANTOM:
00504                         return General::DIRECTION_PHANTOM;
00505                 default:
00506                         return General::DIRECTION_INVALID;
00507         }

00523         }

00526         }

00722 
00723 General::ClockStruct::ClockStruct(QDomNode &clockNode): value_(0),
00724                 timeUnit_(General::NS), attributes_() {
00725 
00726         QString value = clockNode.childNodes().at(0).nodeValue();
00727         value = General::removeWhiteSpace(value);
00728         bool ok = false;
00729         value_ = value.toDouble(&ok);
00730 
00731         // if value could not be successfully parsed
00732         if (value.isNull() || !ok) {
00733                 throw Parse_error(QString("Mandatory value missing in ClockStruct"));
00734                 return;
00735         }
00736 
00737 
00738         // get the attributes
00739         QDomNamedNodeMap attributeMap = clockNode.attributes();
00740         for (int i = 0; i < attributeMap.size(); ++i) {
00741                 QDomNode tempNode = attributeMap.item(i);
00742 
00743                 // get spirit:units attribute value
00744                 if (tempNode.nodeName() == QString("spirit:units")) {
00745                         timeUnit_ = General::str2TimeUnit(tempNode.childNodes().at(i).
00746                                         nodeValue(),General::NS);
00747                 }
00748 
00749                 // other attributes go to QMap
00750                 else {
00751                         QString name = tempNode.nodeName();
00752                         QString value = tempNode.nodeValue();
00753                         attributes_[name] = value;
00754                 }
00755         }
00756 }

00777 General::ClockPulseValue::ClockPulseValue(QDomNode &clockNode): value_(2),
00778                 attributes_() {
00779 
00780         QString value = clockNode.childNodes().at(0).nodeValue();
00781         bool ok = false;
00782         value_ = value.toInt(&ok);
00783 
00784         // if value could not be successfully parsed
00785         if (value.isNull() || !ok) {
00786                 throw Parse_error(QString("Mandatory value missing in "
00787                                 "spirit:clockPulseValue"));
00788                 return;
00789         }
00790 
00791         // get the attributes
00792         General::parseAttributes(clockNode, attributes_);
00793 }

00812 
00813 void General::parseAttributes(const QDomNode &node,
00814                 QMap<QString, QString> &map) {
00815         // parse all the attributes
00816         QDomNamedNodeMap attributeMap = node.attributes();
00817         for (int j = 0; j < attributeMap.size(); ++j) {
00818                 QString name = attributeMap.item(j).nodeName();
00819                 QString value = attributeMap.item(j).nodeValue();
00820                 map[name] = value;
00821         }
00822         return;
00823 }
00824 
00825 void General::writeAttributes(QXmlStreamWriter& writer,
00826                 const QMap<QString, QString>& attributes) {
00827 
00828         // go through all attributes in the map
00829         for (QMap<QString, QString>::const_iterator i = attributes.begin();
00830                         i != attributes.end(); ++i) {
00831                 // write the current attribute
00832                 writer.writeAttribute(i.key(), i.value());
00833         }
00834         return;
00835 }
00836 
00837 General::InterfaceMode General::str2Interfacemode(const QString& str,
00838                 InterfaceMode defaultValue) {
00839         // select the right enum type
00840         if (str == QString("master")) {
00841                 return General::MASTER;
00842         }
00843         else if (str == QString("slave")) {
00844                 return General::SLAVE;
00845         }
00846         else if (str == QString("system")) {
00847                 return General::SYSTEM;
00848         }
00849         else if (str == QString("mirroredMaster")) {
00850                 return General::MIRROREDMASTER;
00851         }
00852         else if (str == QString("mirroredSlave")) {
00853                 return General::MIRROREDSLAVE;
00854         }
00855         else if (str == QString("mirroredSystem")) {
00856                 return General::MIRROREDSYSTEM;
00857         }
00858         else if (str == QString("monitor")) {
00859                 return General::MONITOR;
00860         }
00861         else if (str == QString("undefined")) {
00862                 return General::MODE_UNDEFINED;
00863         }
00864         else {
00865                 return defaultValue;
00866         }
00867 }
00868 
00869 QString General::interfaceMode2Str(const General::InterfaceMode mode) {
00870         switch (mode) {
00871         case General::MASTER: {
00872                 return QString("master");
00873         }
00874         case General::SLAVE: {
00875                 return QString("slave");
00876         }
00877         case General::SYSTEM: {
00878                 return QString("system");
00879         }
00880         case General::MIRROREDMASTER: {
00881                 return QString("mirroredMaster");
00882         }
00883         case General::MIRROREDSLAVE: {
00884                 return QString("mirroredSlave");
00885         }
00886         case General::MIRROREDSYSTEM: {
00887                 return QString("mirroredSystem");
00888         }
00889         case General::MONITOR: {
00890                 return QString("monitor");
00891         }
00892         default: { 
00893                 return QString("undefined");
00894         }
00895         }
00896 }
00897 
00898 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00899 // Function: getCompatibleInterfaceMode()
00900 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00901 General::InterfaceMode General::getCompatibleInterfaceMode(InterfaceMode mode)
00902 {
00903     switch (mode)
00904     {
00905     case General::MASTER: {
00906             return MIRROREDMASTER;
00907         }
00908     case General::SLAVE: {
00909             return MIRROREDSLAVE;
00910         }
00911     case General::SYSTEM: {
00912             return MIRROREDSYSTEM;
00913         }
00914     case General::MIRROREDMASTER: {
00915             return MASTER;
00916         }
00917     case General::MIRROREDSLAVE: {
00918             return SLAVE;
00919         }
00920     case General::MIRROREDSYSTEM: {
00921             return SYSTEM;
00922         }
00923     case General::MONITOR: {
00924             return MONITOR;
00925         }
00926     default: {
00927             Q_ASSERT(false);
00928             return MASTER;
00929         }
00930     }
00931 }
00932 
00933 VLNV General::createVLNV(const QDomNode& node,
00934                 VLNV::IPXactType type) {
00935         // the vlnv info is found as attributes in the node
00936         QDomNamedNodeMap attributeMap = node.attributes();
00937         QString vendor =
00938                         attributeMap.namedItem(SPIRIT_VENDOR).nodeValue();
00939         QString library =
00940                         attributeMap.namedItem(SPIRIT_LIBRARY).nodeValue();
00941         QString name =
00942                         attributeMap.namedItem(SPIRIT_NAME).nodeValue();
00943         QString version =
00944                         attributeMap.namedItem(SPIRIT_VERSION).nodeValue();
00945 
00946         // if invalid vlnv tag
00947         if (vendor.isNull() ||
00948                         library.isNull() ||
00949                         name.isNull() ||
00950                         version.isNull() ) {
00951                 throw Parse_error(QString("Invalid VLNV tag found"));
00952                 return VLNV();
00953         }
00954 
00955         return VLNV(type, vendor, library, name, version);
00956 }
00957 
00958 QString General::removeWhiteSpace(QString str) {
00959         QTextStream stream(&str);
00960         QString resultStr;
00961 
00962         // remove white spaces from the start and the end
00963         str = str.trimmed();
00964 
00965         // keep parsing until the end is reached
00966         while (!stream.atEnd()) {
00967                 QString temp;
00968 
00969                 // strip the whitespace if any is found
00970                 stream.skipWhiteSpace();
00971                 stream >> temp;
00972                 // if there is still characters left in the stream
00973                 if (!stream.atEnd()) {
00974                         // replace the skipped whitespace with '_'
00975                         temp.append("_");
00976                 }
00977                 // add the parsed string to the total string
00978                 resultStr += temp;
00979         }
00980         // return the string that has been stripped from white spaces
00981         return resultStr;
00982 }
00983 
00984 General::Qualifier::Qualifier(QDomNode& qualifierNode): isAddress_(false),
00985                 isData_(false), isClock_(false), isReset_(false) {
00986         for (int i = 0; i < qualifierNode.childNodes().count(); ++i) {
00987                 QDomNode tempNode = qualifierNode.childNodes().at(i);
00988 
00989                 if (tempNode.nodeName() == QString("spirit:isAddress")) {
00990                         QString isAddress = tempNode.childNodes().at(0).nodeValue();
00991                         isAddress_ = General::str2Bool(isAddress, false);
00992                 }
00993 
00994                 else if (tempNode.nodeName() == QString("spirit:isData")) {
00995                         QString isData = tempNode.childNodes().at(0).nodeValue();
00996                         isData_ = General::str2Bool(isData, false);
00997                 }
00998 
00999                 else if (tempNode.nodeName() == QString("spirit:isClock")) {
01000                         QString isClock = tempNode.childNodes().at(0).nodeValue();
01001                         isClock_ = General::str2Bool(isClock, false);
01002                 }
01003 
01004                 else if (tempNode.nodeName() == QString("spirit:isReset")) {
01005                         QString isReset = tempNode.childNodes().at(0).nodeValue();
01006                         isReset_ = General::str2Bool(isReset, false);
01007                 }
01008         }
01009         return;
01010 }

01059 void General::writeVLNVAttributes(QXmlStreamWriter& writer,
01060                 const VLNV* vlnv) {
01061         writer.writeAttribute(SPIRIT_VENDOR, vlnv->getVendor());
01062         writer.writeAttribute(SPIRIT_LIBRARY, vlnv->getLibrary());
01063         writer.writeAttribute(SPIRIT_NAME, vlnv->getName());
01064         writer.writeAttribute(SPIRIT_VERSION, vlnv->getVersion());
01065         return;
01066 }
01067 
01068 QString General::getRelativePath(const QString from, const QString to) {
01069         if (from.isEmpty() || to.isEmpty()) {
01070                 return QString();
01071         }
01072 
01073         // create file info instance to make sure that only the directory of the
01074         // from parameter is used
01075         QFileInfo fromInfo(from);
01076         // if the directory does not exist
01077         QDir ipXactDir(fromInfo.absolutePath());
01078         if (!ipXactDir.exists()) {
01079                 return QString();
01080         }
01081 
01082         // create file info instance to make sure the target file exists and to
01083         // use an absolute file path to calculate the relative path.
01084         QFileInfo toInfo(to);
01085         if (!toInfo.exists()) {
01086                 return QString();
01087         }
01088 
01089         // calculate the relative path and return it.
01090         return ipXactDir.relativeFilePath(toInfo.absoluteFilePath());
01091 }
01092 
01093 QString General::getAbsolutePath(const QString originalPath,
01094                 const QString relativePath) {
01095 
01096         // if one of the parameters is empty
01097         if (originalPath.isEmpty() || relativePath.isEmpty()) {
01098                 return QString();
01099         }
01100 
01101         QFileInfo relativeInfo(relativePath);
01102         if (relativeInfo.isAbsolute()) {
01103                 return relativePath;
01104         }
01105 
01106         // get the directory path of the original path
01107         QFileInfo original(originalPath);
01108         QDir originalDir(original.absolutePath());
01109 
01110         // make sure the path exists
01111         QFileInfo file(originalDir.absoluteFilePath(relativePath));
01112 
01113         return file.canonicalFilePath();
01114 }
01115 
01116 General::NameGroup::NameGroup(): 
01117 name_(),
01118 displayName_(),
01119 description_() {
01120 }
01121 
01122 General::NameGroup::NameGroup(QDomNode& node): name_(), displayName_(),
01123 description_() {
01124 
01125         // search all the node's childNodes and find the right ones.
01126         for (int i = 0; i < node.childNodes().count(); ++i) {
01127                 QDomNode tempNode = node.childNodes().at(i);
01128 
01129                 if (tempNode.nodeName() == QString("spirit:name")) {
01130                         name_ = tempNode.childNodes().at(0).nodeValue();
01131                         name_ = General::removeWhiteSpace(name_);
01132                 }
01133                 else if (tempNode.nodeName() == QString("spirit:displayName")) {
01134                         displayName_ = tempNode.childNodes().at(0).nodeValue();
01135                 }
01136                 else if (tempNode.nodeName() == QString("spirit:description")) {
01137                         description_ = tempNode.childNodes().at(0).nodeValue();
01138                 }
01139         }
01140 }
01141 
01142 General::NameGroup::NameGroup( const QString name ):
01143 name_(name), displayName_(), description_() {
01144 }
01145 
01146 General::NameGroup::NameGroup( const NameGroup& other ):
01147 name_(other.name_),
01148 displayName_(other.displayName_),
01149 description_(other.description_) {
01150 }
01151 
01152 General::NameGroup& General::NameGroup::operator=( const NameGroup& other ) {
01153         if (this != &other) {
01154                 name_ = other.name_;
01155                 displayName_ = other.displayName_;
01156                 description_ = other.description_;
01157         }
01158         return *this;
01159 }
